plugins.name: Get in Line ‚Äî Round off decimals in XY Coordinates, Width & Height
plugins.description:
Tired of those annoying decimal values in your Figma designs? Get in Line is here to straighten things up! üíØ


Whether it's X/Y coordinates, Width, or Height, this plugin rounds off all decimal values to the nearest integer in just one click ‚Äî making your designs pixel-perfect. No more awkward X: 325.49 or Width: 543.8. With Get in Line, you'll get clean, crisp values like X: 325 and Width: 544. ‚ú®


üí• What It Does:

‚úÖ Round off X/Y Coordinates ‚Äî Converts decimal positions into whole numbers.

‚úÖ Round off Width & Height ‚Äî Keeps your shapes, frames, and elements mathematically perfect.

‚úÖ Multi-Select Support ‚Äî Select multiple elements and fix them all at once.

‚úÖ Instant Feedback ‚Äî Know how many elements were aligned after each click.


üöÄ Why Use It?

Pixel Perfection: No more blurry layers caused by decimal positions.

Design Hygiene: Clean, rounded dimensions keep your layout sharp.

Speed Up Workflow: Align multiple elements in one go.

No More OCD Triggering Numbers: Forget about X: 135.72 ‚Äî now it's X: 136. üòé


üí° How It Works:

Select one or more elements (Frames, Shapes, SVGs, anything!).

Hit the "Align" button in the plugin.

Boom! All decimal values in X, Y, Width, and Height are instantly rounded off.

You'll get a notification showing how many elements were aligned. üéâ

üíé Get in Line is perfect for product designers, UI/UX designers, and anyone who craves that perfect, integer-based alignment. Whether you're building a design system, creating components, or fine-tuning layouts ‚Äî this plugin will keep your designs clean and crisp.


üëâ Click 'Open' and make your elements fall in line! üö∂‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è‚ú®

accepted.name: Shubhransh Bhaskar
accepted.description: Sharing my learnings through YouTube ‚Äî Finding inspiration through Photography ‚Äî Focused on creating a therapeutic experience.

plugins.tagline: Convert decimals into integers for Position XY Coordinates, Width & Height at once!

plugins.name: Moospire
plugins.description:
Description for Moospire Figma Plugin;

Moospire‚Äôs Figma plugin is designed to revolutionize how you create and curate moodboards. Whether you're sourcing inspiration from the web or harnessing the power of AI to bring your unique visions to life, this plugin is ideal for designers seeking an efficient way to visualize and consolidate design concepts directly within your Figma projects.


What to Expect from the Moospire Figma Plugin

1. Seamless Web Curation:

This feature allows you to explore and curate moodboards by compiling the most inspiring and relevant content found across the web. Whether you're looking for design trends, color schemes, or visual ideas, Moospire makes it easy to gather these elements directly into your Figma workspace.


2. AI-Powered Creation:

Transform your thoughts into beautifully cohesive moodboards with just a few clicks. Submit your concepts via text, images, sketches, or even voice notes, and watch as Moospire‚Äôs AI effortlessly crafts these inputs into structured moodboards. This feature is particularly beneficial for capturing the essence of spontaneous ideas and turning them into actionable designs.


How to Use the Moospire Figma Plugin

Installation: Begin by installing the Moospire plugin from the Figma plugin store.

Launching Moospire: Access Moospire directly within your Figma project by navigating to the plugin section and selecting Moospire.

Searching and Curating: Use the search feature to find web content or let Moospire suggest materials based on search & past preferences.

Creating with AI: Upload your creative inputs through the plugin‚Äôs interface, and specify the type of moodboard content you need. The AI will process your inputs and generate a moodboard ideas right within your Figma canvas.
plugins.tagline: The Spark you need to create

plugins.name: Batch Description Update
plugins.description:
Adding a description to your Figma's components brings some benefits. When it comes to icons, adding terms and tags can help users find icons in the asset panel. However, maintaining component descriptions can be a lot of work, especially for a long set of icons. This plugin allows users to update all component descriptions with three clicks.

  • Create a .CSV file where the first column is the component name and the second is the desired description;
  • Run the plugin 'Batch Description Update', select the .CSV file, and run the process;
  • Done! Your components have their descriptions updated in no time.
plugins.tagline: Update component description in batch through a .CSV file

plugins.name: Rename Frames - ID generator - Scrum
plugins.description:
Key features:

- Generates unique IDs for your selected frames

- Naming structure: section-project-00000 (5 random digits)

- Intuitive and easy-to-use interface


How it works:

1. Select the frames you want to name

2. Open the plugin and fill in the fields:

- Section: Define the part of the project (e.g., "home", "about", "products")

- Project Nomenclature: Enter your project's code or abbreviation

3. Click "Generate" and you're done! Your selected frames will have new unique names


Perfect for:

- Maintaining consistent nomenclature in large projects

- Facilitating collaboration in design teams

- Improving organization and workflow in Figma

105987.name: Rename Frames - ID generator - Scrum
105987.description:
Key features:

- Generates unique IDs for your selected frames

- Naming structure: section-project-00000 (5 random digits)

- Intuitive and easy-to-use interface


How it works:

1. Select the frames you want to name

2. Open the plugin and fill in the fields:

- Section: Define the part of the project (e.g., "home", "about", "products")

- Project Nomenclature: Enter your project's code or abbreviation

3. Click "Generate" and you're done! Your selected frames will have new unique names


Perfect for:

- Maintaining consistent nomenclature in large projects

- Facilitating collaboration in design teams

- Improving organization and workflow in Figma


Streamline your workflow and keep your Figma files organized with Frame ID Generator.

plugins.name: ÂàáÂõæÂä©Êâã Slice Export Assistant
plugins.description:
Introduction

Slice Export Assistant is a powerful Figma plugin designed specifically for designers to efficiently export selected design elements. Whether you're working on web designs, mobile applications, or icon creation, Slice Export Assistant caters to your diverse needs.


Function Description

  1. Multiple Format Support: Export your designs in various formats including PNG, JPG, SVG, PDF, and WEBP.
  2. Multi-Scale Exporting: Easily set different export scales with automatic increments to save your time.
  3. Custom Suffixes: Assign custom suffixes to each exported file to ensure consistent and organized file naming.
  4. Batch Exporting: Export multiple files at once and automatically generate a ZIP archive for easy downloading and management.
  5. WEBP Conversion: Built-in WEBP format conversion to enhance image optimization efficiency.


How to Use

  1. Select Elements: In Figma, select one or more design elements you wish to export.
  2. Run the Plugin: Right-click on the selected elements, navigate to Plugins > Slice Export Assistant > Export.


Configure Options

  1. Choose Format: Select the desired export format from PNG, JPG, SVG, PDF, or WEBP.
  2. Set Scale and Suffix: Add the required export scales. Each time you click the "Add" button, the scale automatically increments.
  3. Customize Suffixes: Modify or remove suffixes as needed to fit your naming conventions.
  4. Export: Click the Export button. The plugin will export the files based on your settings‚Äîdownloading single files directly or packaging multiple files into a ZIP archive for download.


Precautions

  1. Ensure Correct Selection: Make sure to select the elements you want to export on the canvas; otherwise, the plugin cannot perform the export.
  2. Browser Compatibility: WEBP format conversion relies on the browser's Canvas support. Ensure your browser is compatible.
  3. File Naming: When customizing suffixes, avoid using special characters to ensure the validity of file names.

plugins.name: Multi Text Edit
plugins.description:
Edit multiple text elements in a single text editor


Very helpful for bulk text editing, or ask an LLM for a list of dummy content to paste into the text editor.


Docs

  1. Update Text - each line of the text editor a selected text node in the selected X, Y, or Z order. Shortcut: press Cmd+Enter/Ctrl+Enter while in the typing to 'Update Text.'
  2. Pull Text - fills the text editor with the content of the selected text elements, so you can edit existing text and update it.
  3. Left to Right (X) - fills the leftmost text elements first. Falls back to 'Top to Bottom (Y)' if X values are equal.
  4. Top to Bottom (Y) - fills the topmost text elements first. Falls back to 'Left to Right (X)' if Y values are equal.
  5. Layer order (Z) - fills text elements in the order they appear in the Layers panel.


Tip: Precisely select nested text elements using "Ctrl+Click Drag" to draw a box through a set of text elements. See Figma Docs "Selection Marquee 4." for details.


This plugin was inspired by Multiple Text Editor's "List to Layers" functionality. You might try this other plugin if you'd like to generate random content for text elements in a similar way.


Github Repo
plugins.tagline: Edit multiple text elements in a single text editor

plugins.name: Reablocks Figma Plugin
plugins.description:
Reablocks Figma Plugin

Plugin utilities to supercharge your dev work for reablocks (an open-source repo containing a set of enterprise UI components for React).


Features

CSS Token Generator: Generate Reablock-compatible JSON from Figma Style variables


CSS Token Generator Usage


Pre-requisite

You should have style created for all colors that you want to use in the project

You should use the following naming convention to assign style property to your colors

E.g.: 'Primary', 'Brand', 'Primary/100', 'Brand/title black 100'``


# Running Plugin

- Go to the Figma design file where you want to use the plugin

- Use `CMD + p` to open quick menu

- Search for new plugins using "Find More plugins option" and search for "Reablocks Figma Plugin"

- Once found, click on run plugin, it will open a popup

- Click on "Generate CSS"

- Click on "Copy CSS"

- Use the copied CSS tokens to your project


Development guide

Check the readme file @ https://github.com/reaviz/reablocks-figma-plugin/blob/main/README.md for dev contribution guidelines
plugins.tagline: Your Figma companion for Reablock

plugins.name: Copy-writer agent
plugins.description:
Content Writer Agent: Your Content AI Text Assistant in Figma


Tired of manually tweaking text, fixing typos, translating snippets, or shortening

content within your Figma designs? Content Writer Agent brings the power of

advanced AI directly into your workflow, saving you time and boosting your creativity!

Select any text layers, give a simple instruction (like "Make this more formal",

"Translate to German", "Fix grammar", or "Summarize"), and let the AI handle the

heavy lifting. See the changes side-by-side, compare with the original, and replace

text with a single click.


Key Features:

  1. AI-Powered Editing: Use prompts to rewrite, translate, fix grammar,
  2. shorten, or modify selected text layers.
  3. Side-by-Side Diff: Clearly see the original text and the AI-generated
  4. suggestion, with deletions highlighted.
  5. One-Click Replace: Update single or multiple text layers in your Figma file
  6. instantly.
  7. One-Step Undo: Easily revert any replacement back to the previous text.
  8. Flexible LLM Support: Choose between Google's Gemini (requires API
  9. key) or a self-hosted Ollama instance with your favorite local models. (OpenAI
  10. coming soon!)
  11. Easy Configuration: Simple settings panel to manage your LLM provider
  12. and credentials.
  13. Light & Dark Mode: Adapts automatically or lets you choose via settings.
  14. Free Tier: Get started with 10 free AI generations per day!


Who is it for?

  1. UI/UX Designers: Quickly iterate on microcopy, button labels, and placeholder
  2. Copywriters & Marketers: Draft, refine, and translate marketing copy directly
  3. within design mockups.
  4. Content Creators: Ensure consistency and clarity in text across designs.
  5. Anyone who works with text in Figma!


Getting Started & Configuration Guide

  1. Install: Install the "Content Writer Agent" plugin from the Figma Community.
  2. Run: Right-click on the Figma canvas -> Plugins -> Content Writer Agent.
  3. Basic Use:
  4. Select one or more text layers in your Figma file. The plugin UI will update automatically.
  5. Enter a prompt in the input field (e.g., "Make this punchier").
  6. Click "Generate".
  7. Review the original and generated text in the cards.
  8. Click "Replace" on a card to update that specific text layer in Figma, or
  9. "Replace All Valid" to update all cards with valid generated text.
  10. If you replaced text, an "Undo" button appears allowing you to revert that specific change.
  11. Configure Your AI Provider (Settings):
  12. Click the Settings icon ( ) in the plugin header or the clickable provider tag next to it.
  13. Choose Provider: Select "Gemini", "Ollama", "OpenAI", or "Custom Model..." from the "LLM Provider" dropdown.

a) Gemini Setup:

  1. Select "Gemini" in the dropdown.
  2. You need a Google AI API Key. You can get one for free from Google
  3. AI Studio.
  4. Click the "Get your Gemini API Key" link or visit https://aistudio.google.com/app/apikey.
  5. Copy your generated API key.
  6. Paste the key into the "Gemini API Key" input field in the plugin settings.
  7. Click "Apply Settings".

b) Ollama Setup:

  1. Select "Ollama" in the dropdown.
  2. Ensure Ollama is Installed & Running: You need Ollama running on
  3. your local machine or a reachable server. If you haven't installed it, visit ollama.com.
  4. Enter Server URL: Input the URL where your Ollama server is running (default is http://localhost:11434 ).
  5. Fetch & Select Model: Click the "Refresh" button ( ) next to the URL field. The plugin will attempt to connect and fetch the list of models available on your Ollama server. Select the desired model (e.g., llama3:latest , mistral:latest ) from the "Model Name" dropdown.
  6. (IMPORTANT) CORS Configuration: If fetching models fails (especially with Failed to fetch errors), your Ollama server likely needs CORS configuration to allow requests from Figma. See the detailed instructions within the settings panel error message for help.
  7. Click "Apply Settings".


Need Help or a Custom Model?

If you encounter issues, need support for a different model/provider, or have

feedback, please reach out!

Request Custom Model/Provider: Select "Custom Model..." from the LLM

Provider dropdown in Settings and use the contact link.

General Support/Feedback: Email ahmmigo0@gmail.com

Stop wasting time on repetitive text edits. Install Content Writer Agent and let AI

accelerate your design workflow!
plugins.tagline: Your Content AI Text Assistant in Figma (Choose your prefered LLM model)

plugins.name: Aerial
plugins.description:
Select any object, a frame, section or image. Through a bird's-eye manipulate the viewport to navigate and explore your designs.


Status:

Currently I do not have plans of making updates to this plugin.


Known Bugs/Issues:

  1. Zoom manipulation does not align with the indicator
  2. Zoom controls are mismatched
  3. Indicator position is inconsistent with drag position and zoom level
  4. Some frames or images fail to load properly


This plugin is opensource and can be found here:

https://github.com/uxmauro/figma-plugin-aerial
plugins.tagline: Zoom into your designs and have an extra birds-eye view of your work.

plugins.name: Quick Local Styles
plugins.description:
Effortlessly cycle through text and color styles in your Figma designs. This plugin streamlines your workflow by allowing you to quickly navigate and apply different text and color styles to selected elements.


Key features


  1. Cycle forward and backward through text styles
  2. Cycle forward and backward through color styles
  3. Automatically applies styles to selected elements
  4. Works with local styles in your Figma file

plugins.name: Layer Duplicator Pro
plugins.description:
Layer Duplicator Pro


Layer Duplicator Pro is an innovative plugin for Figma designed to streamline the process of duplicating and modifying design layers using data from Excel spreadsheets. Whether you're managing complex design projects or iterating on prototypes, this tool enhances efficiency and accuracy by integrating structured data seamlessly into your Figma workspace.


Main Features:

  1. Effortless Integration: Import data directly from Excel into Figma to duplicate layers and apply modifications swiftly.
  2. Structured Data Handling: Manage detailed information about design layers through Excel, ensuring precise replication and edits.
  3. Visual Representation: Review and validate changes clearly within Figma, enhancing collaboration and decision-making.
  4. Enhanced Workflow: Optimize design iterations by leveraging Excel's organizational capabilities directly within Figma.


How to Use:

  1. Download Data: Extract specific details from layers into an Excel file. First, select the layer you wish to duplicate. An Excel file with the necessary structure will be automatically generated and downloaded.
  2. Import and Duplicate: Once the automatically generated Excel file has been downloaded, generate rows corresponding to each element that will be duplicated based on the selected layer. You can modify these elements by editing the corresponding columns in the Excel file. Layer Duplicator Pro will automatically adjust the indicated parameters and create a duplicated layer with the desired dimensions.
  3. Review Results: Efficiently validate changes and errors through intuitive visual feedback within Figma.


Benefits:

  1. Increased Productivity: Simplify complex design tasks and accelerate project timelines.
  2. Improved Collaboration: Foster better teamwork by visualizing changes and updates clearly.
  3. Streamlined Processes: Eliminate manual duplication efforts and streamline iterative design workflows.


Next Steps:

Explore how Layer Duplicator Pro can revolutionize your design process by integrating structured data seamlessly from Excel into Figma. Enhance productivity and creativity with a tool designed to simplify and elevate your design workflow.
plugins.tagline: Duplicate, resize, edit text & images swiftly in Figma for streamlined design workflows.

plugins.name: UIDraft: Material Preview
plugins.description:
Live Web Preview for Figma

See your designs come alive in real web environments ‚Äì directly within Figma.


Functional Overview

  1. View Figma frame/group/components as they‚Äôll appear in actual browsers
  2. Auto-converts Figma styles to CSS custom properties hierarchy


How to Use

  1. Choose any frame/group/component node in your Figma file


Operational Constraints

  1. Backgrounds using Figma's CROP fill mode might display unexpected aspect ratios
  2. Complex boolean operations may simplify during web preview rendering
  3. Any layer with rotation ‚â†0¬∞ may render with unexpected alignment.
plugins.tagline: Figma to Live Web Preview in One Click: Skip Handoffs, Boost Workflow

plugins.name: Text to Sequence
plugins.description:
Text to Sequence automatically converts selected text layers to sequential numbers in a Z-pattern flow. Perfect for document page numbers. Simply select text layers and choose your preferred numbering style: standard numbers, padded numbers (01, 02...), or letters (a,b,c... / A,B,C...). You can also set a custom starting number.
